main event: Mr. and Mrs. R.L. Woodwall reported sighting a round silver object in the sky over Chattanooga, Tennessee on 23 March 1950.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to the Chattanooga News-Free Press the same day., The object was described as a round silver object heading toward Lovell., The Woodwalls could not estimate the altitude or speed of the object., A meteorologist suggested that what was observed might have been a weather balloon., No further investigation was planned regarding this incident.
sighted object: a round silver object in the sky
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. R.L. Woodwall, civilian
